Corporate Accounting is an intermediate unit in financial accounting with a primary focus on accounting for companies. Current Australian practice is examined and integrated with broader theoretical perspectives, seeking to provide the student with a comprehensive and up-to-date understanding of the key relevant issues. The unit covers accounting for the main life stages of a corporation—birth, growth, death and taxes. The main areas covered include the nature of companies and their financing; accounting for income tax and goodwill; corporate annual report; disclosures and presentation; and accounting for company liquidation and consolidation. Other areas are also examined which relate to significant issues in the current corporate accounting environment.

general.description:
I am the Global Head of Practice for the Finance, Real Estate and Projects businesses of global law firm Herbert Smith Freehills. 

Prior to the merger of Herbert Smith and Freehills on 1 October 2012, I was the Head of the Perth Office of Freehills and sat on the national Board of that firm for a number of years.  

From merger until 1 October 2015 I was the Australian Regional Managing Partner of Hebert Smith Freehills, and the International Partner, Clients & Sectors for the period 1 May 2014 to 30 September 2015.

I am an infrastructure specialist, acting for Government and the private sector in the delivery of major projects in Australia and overseas.  I have experience in the water, waste, energy, transportation, health and mining and resources sectors.  

I have acted in PPP/PFI transactions, ECI and relationship based projects as well as more traditional infrastructure delivery methodologies.

I am an FAICD and sit on the Board of the Art Gallery of WA.

general.headline: Director at Butlers, Barristers & Solicitors
general.description:
I am a Barrister and Solicitor of the Supreme Court of Western Australia, a Solicitor of the Supreme Court of New South Wales, a Barrister and Solicitor of the Supreme Court of the Australian Capital Territory, and on the Roll of Legal Practitioners for the High Court of Australia. I have been admitted to practice for 44 years, and have worked in the law for almost 50 years.

I was previously a partner in a national legal firm and have since established my own practice. I am currently the principal of the legal firm known as "Butlers" which is based in Nedlands, Western Australia. Much of my practice over the last 44 years has been in the areas of Business and Estate Planning, Wills & Estates, and Family Law.

I served with the Australian Army Reserve for 13 years, as a Commissioned Officer, and I am presently on the Reserve of Officers. 

I believe strongly in the power of a community to create what it wants. I regularly speak to various groups within the community. I am also a member of Rotary.

Amongst my other interests, I am currently the State co-ordinator for Global Energy Network Institute (GENI) an international organisation which is actively involved in energy and environmental issues. 

At Butlers, I place a strong emphasis on creating a learning environment, where members of the Team can share their knowledge and enjoy learning.  The firm of Butlers is committed to optimising the use of technology and I am actively involved in developing the delivery of legal services over the Internet. Because I enthusiastically embrace technology, I enjoy the freedom of jumping on a plane with my ultra-light notebook computer and PDA, while still being available to clients and Team Members.

general.description:
If you are an insurance claims specialist, an executive or HR professional I would be delighted to advise you on effective claims handling, professional indemnity and EPL insurance coverage or litigation and dispute resolution. 

For more than 13 years, my relationships with Australian and international insurers, underwriting PI, D&O and construction risk, have led to me to advise and act for a wide range of professionals and entities. These clients include construction and engineering professionals, education providers, local councils, financial professionals, healthcare entities, estate agents, valuers and manufacturers. To this end, I design and execute defence strategies for insureds and provide complex coverage advice. Through title insurers, I also conduct property and mortgage recoveries tainted with fraud, involving long-tail, multi-party proceedings.

My employment law expertise involves me in exclusively acting for employers - both on instructions from underwriters and directly - in unfair dismissal, general protections, discrimination and other workplace-related claims. My team and I also provide risk management advice and legal representation in connection with terminations, redundancies, performance management, employment contracts, sub-contractor arrangements, entitlements and best practice workplace policies.  

Best Lawyers 2018 has recognised me for my Insurance Law expertise and I am currently the Victorian President of the Australian Professional Indemnity Group. 

Should you wish to explore with me how I can support you and your business to deal effectively with insurance claims, dispute resolution and employment risk management strategies, please contact me via LinkedIn InMail or email: cathryn.prowse@cbp.com.au

jobs.description:
Australian Young Labor (AYL) is the largest youth political organisation in Australia. 

AYL represents young people from 14 to 26 within the Labor party, and has been in working hard to represent young people within Australian Labor for over 35 years.

Australian Young Labor advocates policies that push for the needs & desires of young Australians. Young Labor seeks to proactively engage every member from around Australia to take part in policy debate, campaigning, personal development and leadership elections.

Australian Young Labor seeks to promote the core values and works of the great Australian Labor Party. We are a group of committed and principled young people who fight to ensure the views of young people are strongly represented in the Labor Party. Members work together throughout the country to support their peers to bring about the greatest possible contribution to the labour movement. We work across State & Territory boundaries to reelect Labor Governments and campaign for an Australian Labor Government together.

general.headline: Special Counsel at Colin Biggers & Paisley
general.description:
Debbie Kaminskas is a special counsel in the insurance team. Debbie specialises in the area of insurance litigation and focuses on the defence of general liability and professional indemnity claims. Debbie has acted for insurers in Australia and overseas in addition to corporations. 

Debbie’s experience in personal injury litigation spans a wide range of claims from relatively minor injuries to catastrophic injuries including paraplegia and quadriplegia cases. Debbie provides cost effective and commercial solutions while representing a wide range of insured persons/entities including occupiers, sporting venues, recreational activity operators, commercial building owners, principal contractors, host employers, hotels, clubs, supermarkets and retailers. 

In the area of professional indemnity, Debbie has acted for doctors, architects, accountants, lawyers, engineers, chiropractors, physiotherapists, psychologists, nursing home operators, real estate agents, insurance brokers and a wide range of other professionals. She has practiced extensively in the Local, District and Supreme Courts over multiple jurisdictions in addition to having experience with coronial inquests, the Health Care Complaints Commission, Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency, Human Rights Commission and Office of the Privacy Commissioner.  
Debbie also has experience providing coverage advice with both general liability and professional indemnity policies of insurance.

Debbie was admitted as a solicitor of South Australia in October 2005. She is admitted to practice in the Supreme Court of New South Wales, Federal Court and High Court of Australia and previously practiced in South Australia and Queensland prior to joining Colin Biggers & Paisley in 2006.

She is a member of the Law Society of New South Wales, Women's Lawyers Association, Australian Professional Indemnity Group, Australian Insurance Law Association, Property Liability Discussion Group and Women in Insurance.

general.headline: National CBP Exchange Manager at Colin Biggers & Paisley
general.description:
Online Conveyancing - CBP Exchange 

We have revolutionised the property industry by our innovative use of paperless technology. We were the first legal practice to develop such electronic contracts, allowing our clients to have access to a new way of purchasing properties.

This state-of-the-art technology for issuing and entering into electronic contracts for sale replaces the need for paper contracts. Formed using DocuSign technology, it enables the contract to be signed electronically by any party anywhere in the world on any device. This technology ensures that the contract is secure and cannot be changed without detection.

CBP Exchange allows for the issue and exchange of property e-contracts and statutory disclosures providing a range of advantages to developers, including:

- cost efficiencies through reduced documentation
- a reduction in the probability of administrative error
- a reduced risk of legal error
- eliminating delays arising from the geographical location of prospective buyers
- obtaining efficiencies through the speed of the e-conveyancing system
- achieving certainty in the contract issue and execution process

CBP Exchange can be accessed online at any time and provides real-time reporting on the status of contracts issued and properties available for sale.

CBP Exchange has been thoroughly market tested and used to sign up purchasers in Australia, Asia, Europe, Canada and the USA.

We have utilised the system in off-the-plan apartment launches, high volume launches and standard exchange situations. We have already exchanged over 2,000 e-contracts for properties in Queensland and New South Wales.

general.description:
Anisa Memari is a senior associate in the commercial and dispute resolution team with proficiency in all aspects of commercial litigation and dispute resolution, as well as experience in construction law, superannuation, employment and workplace relations law.
  
 Anisa is a commercial litigator with both private practice and in-house experience. She understands the commercial and practical realities of legal practice and that it involves more than just a solid understanding of the law. Anisa has experience in litigating large-scale commercial disputes in the context of contractual disputes, corporate insolvency, property matters and trade practices claims. She acts for local and international clients from a variety of industries on commercial disputes, as well as for respondent companies and claims insurers for misleading or deceptive conduct, breach of contract, negligence (including professional negligence) and breach of statutory duty. Anisa also acts in complex commercial and securities litigation disputes, white-collar crime and regulatory enforcement cases. She has litigated and advised high net worth individuals, property developers and multi-million dollar engineering breach of contract claims.
  
 Anisa has also provided pro bono legal services and always stood for equality and fairness. She has extensive experience in indigenous, refugee, disability, human rights, children, women and homeless legal services.

general.description:
The Flinders Legal Advice Clinic (FLAC) is a Community Legal Centre providing free legal advice to the community.  Very experienced legal practitioners supervise Flinders University students studying law in providing this service.

FLAC is proudly client-focused.  Its double purpose is to provide high quality free legal advice while building capacity and scaffolding the learning of law students as they transition to junior practitioners.

FLAC has expanded in recent times beyond the original 'live-client' services.  In 2017 / 2018 it provided students with experiences in -
- Legal Tech clinic creating new legal technology (yet to be released) 
- Start-Up / Entrepreneur Workshop and legal advice clinic
- Externship with Welfare Rights Centre

jobs.description:
The Flinders Legal Advice Clinic is operated by the College of Business, Government & Law, Flinders University, Adelaide, South Australia.  As Director I am responsible for design, development, implementation and delivery, review and forward planning of the clinical education program delivered by the clinic.  

This clinic works as a 'spoke and hub' clinic with outreach services based in various locations including: on the Bedford Park campus, at the Cooinda Neighbourhood Centre (Marion) and until 2016 at the Christies Beach Magistrates' Court.  In 2015 the clinic also commenced a Migration Clinic assisting RASSA (Refugee Advocacy Service of South Australia) which continued until 2017.  Each 'live-client' clinic operates one day a week throughout the University year with the Cooinda service continuing one day a week beyond the University year and closing only for a period over December and January each year.

The clinic ran a Start-Ups/Entrepreneur clinic in a pop-up format in Dec '17 & Feb '18 which will be repeated in semester 2, 2018.

The clinic has commenced a collaboration with the Welfare Rights Centre Inc. in 2018 with clinic students being placed on an externship with the WRC.

The clinic piloted a Legal Tech clinic developing a chatbot in 2017/18 which is on target to be released in beta version in 2018.  A reiteration of the Legal Tech clinic is in development.

general.headline: Associate at Stacks Champion
general.description:
Zohra Ali is a young and upcoming legal practitioner, admitted to practice in New South Wales in December 2014. Prior to admission, Zohra cultivated herself a formidable career at Western Sydney University. Zohra’s career at Western Sydney University commenced in 2010 with a role as a Contact Services Officer at the Contact Service Centre. Zohra was quickly promoted to the role of Postgraduate Officer and Team Leader in 2011, and was again promoted in 2013 to the role of the Contact Services Coordinator. 

Whilst building her career at the University, Zohra took the initiative to build her legal experience, in view of making her later transition into the legal industry. Zohra worked at the Parramatta Community Justice Clinic and worked as a Paralegal at Fragomen, an international immigration law firm. Zohra was mentored by a senior commercial law accredited specialist at Coleman Greig Lawyers and completed a summer clerkship at Champion Legal.

Upon admission, Zohra commenced a graduate program with Transport for NSW, working in the in house legal department, before making the decision to enter the private, legal sector and commencing a role as Solicitor with Stacks Champion in December 2015. Since commencing, Zohra has worked in a generalist capacity across a span of areas including but not limited to family law, wills, probate and estate planning, building disputes, defamation, fencing disputes, trusts, taxation, commercial, conveyancing, debt recovery, insolvency and bankruptcy. Zohra regularly appears in the Supreme Court, District Court, Local Court, Federal Court, Family Court and the Federal Circuit Court of Australia. 

If you would like to contact Zohra, please call 02 8676 6426 or send an email to zali@stacklaw.com.au

To view Zohra's latest, published article, please visit:
https://www.stacklaw.com.au/news/bankruptcy/costs-orders-and-litigation-beware-unpredictable-outcomes-and-always-take-settlement-offers-seriously/

general.headline: Human Rights Principal at South32
general.school: Massachusetts Institute of Technology - Sloan School of Management
general.description:
Robyn is passionate about developing a strong eco-system to foster social impact.

In her role at South32, Robyn leads all human rights related work at this multi-commodity, global mining company, including creating and managing the implementation of the company’s human rights strategy. Robyn has a core focus on assisting Australian companies to be more ‘human centred’, rethinking the way we do business as a lever for broader social transformation. A former Disputes lawyer at Herbert Smith Freehills, Robyn went on to lead the Fogarty Foundation, a West Australian Not-for-Profit focused on advancing social change through education, before joining South32. She is extensively involved in social sector and community initiatives, including the Centre for Social Impact at UWA and the JDRF State Management Group and is recognised by the World Economic Forum as a Perth Global Shaper. 

Robyn believes in putting people at the heart of any solution through working at the intersection of creativity and insights, people and technology, organisations and social impact.

jobs.jobTitle: Human Rights and Social Conflict Specialist
jobs.description:
Robyn works in corporate sustainability with a focus on business and human rights.
      
      Robyn is currently managing the implementation of South32's human rights strategy.

Global Shapers are individuals recognized by the World Economic Forum for their
      potential for future leadership roles in society. They are selected on the basis of their
      
      achievements, leadership potential and commitment to make a difference.

JDRF (Juvenille Diabetes Research Foundation) is the leading global organisation funding Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) research. JDRF Australia is built on a grassroots model of people connecting in their local communities, collaborating regionally for efficiency and broader fundraising impact and uniting on an international stage to pool resources, passion and energy. 

JDRF's mission is to accelerate life-changing breakthroughs to cure, prevent and treat T1D and its complications. 

Robyn is a Type 1 diabetic and as a member of the WA State Leadership Group, she values the opportunity to contribute to this organisation and the important research they do.

Robyn strategically leads the Foundation, a West Australian based collaborative, multi-program, AUD $1M+ organisation that aims to advance social change through education. 

Robyn provides support to effectively and efficiently carry out the operations of the Foundation.

Robyn manages the UWA Fogarty Scholarships & Leadership Program, where scholarship recipients receive financial and mentoring support and participate in a tailored Leadership Program (currently >100 Scholars & Alumni). 

Robyn also provides management support to the Foundation's other 2 major programs: 

• CoderDojo WA: network of free computer coding and digital literacy clubs for children (currently >100 clubs in Western Australia, supported by >300 volunteers and attended by >1700 children). 
• Fogarty EDvance: 3 year whole school improvement program that improves academic outcomes for students in low SES communities by enhancing leadership skills of the Principals and Leadership Teams in these schools (currently 34 schools, >45 principal & >120 school leaders, improving educational outcomes for >9000 students).

Robyn has guided the Foundation through significant growth and scale, enhancing existing operations and initiating, managing and delivering several major change projects at the Foundation.

Robyn primarily worked in the Dispute Resolution team and completed a 6 month
      
      rotation in both the Energy & Resources and Employment teams.
Paralegal in the Banking and Finance team.

schools.schoolName: Massachusetts Institute of Technology - Sloan School of Management
schools.description: The most pressing challenges leaders and teams face today require innovative thinking and collaboration across traditional boundaries – departments, organizations, sectors, and cultures. Yet we are entrenched in rigid patterns of behavior that limit our ability to transcend these boundaries and work together effect deep change. To bring about the level of transformation needed in our organizations and our world right now, we need a way of learning and of leading – one not limited to reflecting the patterns of the past but one that tunes into the possibilities of the future. This program is based on the “U model” featured in Theory U and Presence: Human Purpose and the Field of the Future, co-authored by Peter Senge, Joseph Jaworski, and Betty Sue Flowers.
One week Strategic Finance Course on critical business decisions & value creation

general.headline: Partner | Insurance & Reinsurance | Transport & Logistics | Dispute Resolution
general.description:
If you are an insurance claims professional or leader of a transport, trade or logistics business, I would be pleased to advise you on any aspect of insurance related to trade and transport law, and dispute resolution involving carriage by road, rail, air and sea. 

For close to 30 years, I have been involved with the drafting of supply chain and logistics contracts - from the perspective of an experienced liability lawyer and with a particular emphasis on plain English drafting. A former Federal Secretary of the Maritime Law Association of Australia and New Zealand and current President of the Aviation Law Association of Australia and New Zealand, my network and connections with other insurance, trade and transport practitioners in Australia and globally is second to none. 
 
Chambers and Partners, Doyle's Guide, Legal 500 and Best Lawyers have consistently recognised my insurance law expertise, especially relating to aviation, shipping and general transport. I have authored the marine and aviation insurance sections of the Lexis Nexis publication Australian Insurance Law and am a recognised expert in these fields.
 
Should you wish to discuss how I can support you and your business on trade, transport and logistics insurance matters, please contact me via LinkedIn InMail or email me: Andrew.tulloch@cbp.com.au

Specialties: Insurance & Reinsurance | Supply chain & Logistics | Trade & Transportation Law (Marine, Road, Rail, Aviation) | Contract & policy drafting and interpretation

general.description:
Greg McCann is a partner in the workplace relations and work health and safety team within Colin Biggers and Paisly..

Greg has many years' experience in private practice in Melbourne, Sydney and Perth, working for national corporations in a wide range of industries including transport, mining, retail, labour hire and oil and gas.

Greg is an expert in work health and safety with over 18 years' experience. He has acted in numerous WHS cases and has assisted many corporations with strategic safety advice, including advice and seminars to directors and officers on their WHS responsibilities.

Greg has successfully acted for a number of corporations seeking to obtain return to work orders or to impose employment restraints on departing members of staff. He has considerable experience representing employers in claims of unfair dismissal and harassment and discrimination complaints. His work extends to advising corporations on the creation and implementation of appropriate workplace behaviour policies and procedures.

Greg joined the firm in 2013.

Rebecca believes strongly in her father’s ideals of communicating a clear and honest price guide up front with buyers and maintaining an open and straight-forward communication throughout the sale campaign. When you deal with Rebecca, what you get is what you see.

With an impressive list of sales under her belt, Rebecca is Making it Happen in the Artarmon marketplace! If you want great results, you couldn’t be in better hands!

general.headline: Inner Bath
general.description:
The ideal product for REAL ESTATE PROPERTY MANAGERS, STRATA and BUILDING MANAGERS and HOTELS / SERVICED APARTMENTS the Inner Bath can rejuvenate old worn or damaged baths and shower bases in under 3 hours with a new moulded acrylic bath that fits into existing baths/showers.

And the best part is....there is no down time and the refurbished bath can be used the very same day as the installation - that means no hassles for your tenants or guests.

It is manufactured right here in Australia to the highest standards and is finished in a gloss acrylic surface that is easy to clean and can be used the very same day with no disruption to your bathroom.

Inner Bath uses your existing bath as a foundation into which is fitted a new, permanent, specially moulded and exceptionally durable acrylic bath.

Inner Bath comes in a range of shapes and sizes which will fit inside the most modern baths and even those up to 100 years old.

See how Inner Bath can help you and your clients - www.innerbath.com.au

jobs.description:
Supply and installation of a cost effective, speedy solution to bath tub and shower base repair and refurbishment in the greater Sydney area from Sydney to the Illawarra, through to the Blue Mountains and the Hunter Valley.

A popular solution for:-
- hotels, serviced apartments, resorts, motels, caravan parks and the like
- real estate agents / real estate property managers / strata managers
- households
- plumbers, builders, building maintenance, renovators
- state housing authorities
- defence housing

When most Property Managers think of bathroom renovations, they aren't thinking about “hassle  and mess free” in the same thought.

Inner Bath aims to change that. 

In around 3 hours, we can give your clients old bath a brand new look, and you'll never have to lift a finger, except to pick up the phone to call.

If the thought of the dust and debris from a renovation covering every surface of your clients property makes you shudder, fear not. "Unlike other bathtub renovation methods we don’t rip the place apart," says Inner Bath's Gary Long.

Inner Bath places an acrylic insert over the existing bathtub for a hassle-free and debris-free complete makeover. Inner Bath offers a wide variety of bath insert styles to choose from to suit almost every bath, including claw baths.

There's no maintenance needed for an Inner Bath bathtub - simply cleaning it periodically will keep
your tub looking as good as new. Acrylic is durable and scratch-resistant - it's a tough product that
will look great for years to come.

A bath insert from Inner Bath comes with a 10 year guarantee for owner occupiers and a 5 year guarantee for rental properties, so you and your clients will be worry-free for years to come.

general.headline: State Sales Manager at Lendlease
general.description:
Lendlease has been helping Australians enjoy a better way of life for more than 50 years, building beautiful master-planned communities. Whether you buy a block of land and build a new home with the builder of your choice, move into a ready built residence, or buy a complete Home and Land package, you’ll find a Lend Lease community to suit your lifestyle and budget.
Lend Lease has been creating Australia’s best communities since the 1950s. Acquiring Delfin in 2001, we brought two like-minded organisations together, both committed to creating authentic communities and great places to live. With a rich history in master planned development, Lend Lease has been at the forefront of creating communities of significance in every state and territory of mainland Australia, with more than 45 major communities delivered over 50 years. By the completion of our current portfolio, Lend Lease will provide homes & communities to a population similar in size to Australia’s capital, Canberra (approximately 360,000).

general.description:
As seen in the Financial Review, Money Management & Financial Standard publications, to name a few.

I help people achieve their goals from a financial perspective by helping them make wise financial decisions.

Since having kids, I am also interested in how busy parents can get more done, so there is more time for fun.

As a Partner, I advise my own customers, as well as lead a team of nine (9), including Financial Advisers and assistants who are passionate about helping people too.

I have found over the past 20 years when providing financial advice, that most people are not aware of the opportunities they are missing out on and the risks they are exposed. 

Over my whole career at Westpac/BT, it has been nice to be recognised as Financial Adviser of the Year as well as being a regular National Conference qualifier, which is awarded to BT Advisers with high performance. I am also proud to have a customer review rating of 4.9/5 as well as representing BT Advice in the media.  

Prior to Financial Planning I was fortunate to win State, National and World championships in several classes in sailing as well as being selected to attend the Australian Institute of Sport (AIS).

I am passionate about being an adviser as I really enjoy learning formulas for success and sharing them to help others. I believe successful strategies should be shared.

What my customers say can be found at www.btadviserview.com.au. As examples, please find two comments.

"I have known Roger since his commencement with BT & in that time I have found him to be a trustworthy, knowledgeable & a very reliable Adviser. Roger understand his clients requirements & acts in their best interest." Graydon Conde

"Roger explains things clearly and makes it easy to understand. He responds to my needs and follows through. he demonstrates knowledge and expertise. I never have been happier before now. I feel I have the best adviser." Rawa Norman

general.headline: Property & Construction opportunities | 27,000+ connections
general.description:
Our Story; www.bypass.net.au/about

Bypass is an online recruitment portal connecting Property and Construction professionals with employers. 

Consisting of a team of former construction professionals, Bypass understands the intricacies of working in this industry and prides itself on delivering the best possible value to both employers and candidates.

For employers - Bypass provides an agency service at a fraction of the cost. We don't believe that flicking a few resumes around justifies a $10,000+ placement fee. Simply post your ad on the noticeboard, then sit back and let us find talented pre-approved candidates for you. No more recruiter fees, no more hefty commissions or charges. Save $10k+ per hire.

For candidates - You will only find genuine employer opportunities on Bypass. We are not your everyday recruiters, and we don't ‘fish’ with fake job ads. Help your future employer save $10k+ when they hire you by applying through Bypass. 

We provide the connections and assistance you need to take the next step in your career path. 

Looking to hire or open to hearing about new career opportunities? Call 1300 314 125 for a private and confidential chat.

general.description:
With a Degree Qualification in Construction Management and nearly 10 years' industry experience I am now providing recruitment services and staffing solutions to the Construction Industry.

I started out “getting my feet wet” with odd labouring roles before getting a position as a Cadet in Fitout & Refurbishment on site and then transitioning to the office to become a Contract Administrator. As a CA I worked for both the commercial & residential sectors across a diverse range of projects incl. shopping centers, apartments, social housing and luxury homes. As my career progressed I became a Project Manager for a prominent NSW residential builder and completed retirement villages, community housing and medium density residential estates. 

My time in the industry has seen me work alongside construction professionals, engineers, contractors & consultants of all types. It has given me a keen awareness of the traits & requirements necessary to succeed in these roles.

I am a communications specialist with particular expertise in stakeholder and reputation management and strategy, as well as extensive copywriting and editing experience. 

I'm currently working with Australian law firm Lander & Rogers in its Business Development & Marketing team, having previously managed the communications function at the Australian Communities Foundation.

Prior to this I spent four years in the Corporate Affairs team at Which?, the UK’s high-profile consumer association, following roles in leading financial services and retail companies.

jobs.description:
Australian Communities Foundation (ACF) is a not-for-profit organisation established to help philanthropic individuals and organisations support the needs of communities across the country. 

As a central role in a very small but ambitious organisation, I had a large remit with responsibility for all external communications channels (including PR, social media, client communications, website), while remaining flexible to support the organisation.

Responsibilities:
• Copywriting, editing, and project managing the production of the annual report, working with design agencies to create materials that can be used to promote ACF to stakeholders including both existing and future sub-fund owners.
• Managing ACF’s presence on social media (Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn) including generating content from within the organisation to engage the philanthropic community, and promote ACF’s services and expertise to the public.

• Using MailChimp to create and distribute regular newsletters to stakeholders.

To manage Which?'s corporate reputation, I would provide crisis communications advice to departments within Which? in relation to contentious and libel issues that arise from the publication of Which?’s magazines and consumer advocacy activity, reacting quickly to relevant external announcements. I would regularly communicate sensitive information with companies that they may find concerning, as well as explain complicated technical survey and product testing methodologies. 

Taking a consultative approach, I'd work with those companies to use the research insight to improve their products or services. This involved working with large, well-known consumer brands on customer safety issues, including: 
•	working with a number of high street retailers on the provision and accuracy of their child car seat fitting advice;
•	helping fire alarm manufacturers to improve the performance of their fire alarms so that they reach the industry safety standard;
•	encouraging sunscreen producers to review their formulas in light of failed test results; and 
•	supporting home goods manufacturers to understand negative test results to improve the performance and safety of their products, particularly with regard to fire risks.

general.headline: FTA is a Melbourne based Football, Futsal & School Program for children
general.description:
About FTA
Football Technique Australia (FTA) is a Melbourne based football, futsal & school program that has a specific focus on improving individual technique, skill & football intelligence. FTA conducts programs for boys and girls from the ages of 6 to 14.

FTA Vision & Philosophy
FTA believes in a step by step development process that provides young footballers with a unique opportunity to develop and master the necessary technical skills possessed by elite footballers. FTA's football programs provide structured technical development and possession based football that distinguishes our approach from normal club football. We have a clear vision in the type of player we wish to produce and believe that in providing this type of concentrated training, we guide players to improve individual skill, technique, decision-making and tactical awareness.

FTA Mission Statement
"To create a positive environment whereby players are educated and taught to express themselves, achieve their maximum potential and master the technical skills of the World Game to become an elite player."

general.headline:
Strategic Agility Facilitator;  Business Advisory at Elabor8; 
Heart of Agile Guide
general.description:
I hold deeply that agile is a human centred approach where the ultimate goal is to make work better for people. To do this you need to understand how work happens in an organisation and plan, contextually, on how to enable leaders to create the space for people to work differently. This involves delving deeply into a companies purpose, seeing that linkage to strategy, working on organisational structures to free it up and allow meaningful work to flow, shortening the distance to value creation. Enabled by uplifting peoples capability and remodelling the workforce for the modern digital age. My passion is helping people realise change starts with them and giving them the advice and support needed to make it happen at scale.

Im working with an awesome group of people at Elabor8, and our mission is “We aspire to be Australia’s leading globally recognised contemporary management consultancy”. We help our clients speed the creation of customer value through a focus on people, teams and organisational agility. 

Think Different. Think Sharp.

jobs.description:
At Elabor8, we help our clients speed the creation of customer value through a focus on people, teams and organisational agility. Elabor8 works from within to unlock the promise of agility by instilling the mindsets and systems that are crucial to innovation.

To compete in a digital first world organisations need to realise the potential of every person in their organisation so that they can be freed up to move, pivot and respond.

Through advisory, coaching and training, we can help your organisation create the muscle memory that enables your organisation to rapidly respond to customer demand.

The Heart of Agile is a growing, community based global movement to get people to think back to the essence of what agile thinking is about. The Heart of Agile simplifies two decades of practice into four critical imperatives that amplify your effectiveness underpinned by a community:

Collaborate
Deliver
Reflect
Improve

The four words help us to focus our energies on critical actions. At the same time, this simplification opens the door to many new and interesting ways of implementing each one of them. The community helps us grow our understanding and gives us the ability to learn new and interesting things. 

If you are intersted in exploring the essence of agility we hold a regular Meetup Group in Melbourne:
https://www.meetup.com/Heart-Of-Agile-Community-Melbourne.

If you are some place else in the world, we have a growing number of Meetups you could attend - or you could start one of your own! We will help you get moving. Check the main website for a location near you: 
https://heartofagile.com/communities/

I  personally use Heart of Agile as a model for getting back to basics, exploring the simplicity of Agile, unfolding the deeper ideas and concepts it leads to. Heart of Agile can be used in parallel to any agile method or framework, or in its own right as an Agile method. It's four simple questions to assess where you are , the nature of where you are, and what you want to do next. It’s a tool to simply cut through the current noise around Agile. The fact that it is open-sourced and community-based around the four key words is part of its power.

A team of passionate sportspeople , we BELIEVE that digitisation in the 21st century means that people all over the world can have the same access to training advice as the highly paid professionals. On demand, free, globally available Video as the delivery mechanism can give you the edge over your peers - and help you become a better player. We are  disrupting the global sporting industry and the current perception that coaching to improve how people play their chosen sports is restricted to elite athletes only at exorbitant prices, and on difficult terms. We are bringing sporting knowledge to the people!

Credibility +  Experience + Trust = Credus Partners

In the face of exploding complexity, you already know you need to change how you identify, create and deliver value. We bring customer insights, data analytics and technology together alongside helping your people implement the working practices that allows them to respond to and initiate change, to ensure your brand remains competitive. We help you to re-design your organisation to survive and thrive.

Make this Transformation your LAST Transformation.

www.credus.com.au
